author: Lewis Hawley
comment: App does not sync steps and other health data from android wear to phone app but instead records data separately on the app and on the watch (ticwatch e). There is no way to force a manual sync for real time data either. Wanting to pair with my fitness pal like I did with my fitbit charge but doesn't work anywhere near as good. Expect much better from Google's own apps and software working together.

author: AKIS A.
comment: This app is hideously inaccurate. It is danger for your health. Different numbers on watch, different on fit site, different on phone. It syncs random numbers. A lot of crashes on watch and incossisent battery consumption. It is now 2 years with zero fixes only changes to aesthetics of UI.

author: Ron Lees
comment: Pretty much the same results as others users here. Total inconsistency between the steps on watch and phone, even though they are in sync (same goals, weight, height updates appear on both devices). I do have settings on phone set for syncing as per Fit Help page but it makes no difference. Not interested in workouts or being location tracked 24 hours a day, just want a basic step count to show up on my phone.

author: Kevin Turner
comment: I have this app on my an Android Wear watch and my phone.  I was under the impression it would work some what like Fitbit. Wrong. This app does not sync properly between multiple devices. It is like the app on my watch and the app on my phone operate independently even though it is the same account on both. And don't even bother with customer service/support. There is a lot of potential, but unfortunately it needs a lot of work. Overall I'm very disappointed.

author: Dominik Sparling
comment: After writing my initial review, I've done some pondering, and my opinion of Google Fit has kinda done a 180. The point of this app is to be a central hub with really really good activity logging built in. Nutrition logging and pre-made workouts isn't the point - the point is to bring all those services that other developers do better and to put a central focus on goals. I love how I can connect all the services I love to one app, and look and have a quick glance of my day. Despite this, there are some things I would like. A health coach would be nice, especially with Google's Machine learning, some mild sleep tracking would be nice, but not important. What I'd really like is a deeper dive into my Fit-created data such as the ability to tab on my goals and get a more comprehensive breakdown, but it still does its job as a data hub really well.

author: Mike Morley
comment: What a joke this app is. Data on phone doesn't match on watch or online, according to online and watch i've done 0 steps, yet on phone it shows 16K, if I check different app on watch it shows 16K, but not GF it says 0 - online it shows done x amount of walking, while on my phone it shows only 1/4 of the figure and on watch 0. this app can't be relied on as the data is so incorrect. if it wasn't for runtastic or huawei health I wouldn't be able to see my data correctly. JUST A TOTAL JOKE THIS APP

author: Ryan Brown
comment: After using Google fit, samsung health and fitbit i have to say this is by FAR the worst, its a lot harder to see workouts etc and after trying to make it look user friendly google have infact made it not user friendly.  If u can do it without a lawsuit go and get someone to copy one of the aforementioned apps!

author: cam car
comment: Love the app but would be cool if you could add friends and compete against them or other Google Fit users in your area. I find myself being more motivated when I can compete against someone else. Hopefully you add this soon.

author: Peter Weyandt
comment: Some cool features  but I dont find it that  accurate .  I use it with a Gen 1 moto x and android wear on a Moto 360. Steps are significantly off. Rating 2 stars   Update 1:   I got a fit bit, it worked perfectly but is not integrated as much as AW watches.  So, I pulled out my Moto 360 again and tried Fit to see if it improved.  I could not get it to track steps on my watch.  The good news is that I just updated my watch.  A new Huawei Watch and guess what, Google fit does not work at all.  it does not track steps.  Two thumbs down.  The Huawei software works fine.  I will try other apps but I think Google Fit has wasted enough of my time. I really want it to work but alas...it does not.  I want to remove it from my phone and watch both but now it looks like it is integrated into the OS on both. Rating 1 star.  Update 2: I tried to delete the app but could only deactivate it and delete all the data off my phone.  I just could not leave well enough alone and eventually tried it again.   I was able to connect the Wuawei fitness app to Fit via the Wuawei app.  Fit started to work. Seems to work ok now.  Rating 3 stars.  Update...new watch LG watch Sport ....sync does not work well.  App is a an absolute failure.

author: Meyer Wallace
comment: It's meh. Google could learn a thing or two from Samsung Health in the layout department. But someone else mentioned it's more of a hub for other fitness apps than a standalone fitness app itself, which I totally agree with

author: Laverne Krahenbil
comment: App is easy to use.  Just totally inaccurate.   Distance even when connected to phone GPS it is off at least 30%.  Pace varies dramatically.  Map shows widely varying path I took.  I was even walking on water once.

author: Joseph Foster
comment: Step reporting on the LG sport watch is completely inaccurate showing about 200% of what the steps likely should be. I originally thought that it was because I had the app both on my phone and on my watch , but even taking it off of my phone it continues to report the same. This causes the app to be completely unusable since it's inaccurate.

author: Dexter McCrea
comment: Latest update broke the ability to view your workouts in Android Wear. If you select a past workout you get a spinning circle, then it times out back to the watch face

author: Albert Ng
comment: Unless app for both my Sony Xperia Premium mobile and SmartWatch. The app doesn't record everything accurately.

author: Pam Beach
comment: Stopped syncing to fit about ten days ago, no fix yet

author: Jacob Bondt
comment: This is the worst piece of junk in the app store  Wake up Google and fix you're junk.

author: Adina Nichols
comment: I am unable to get the app to sync with my watch.

author: Stephen Bertke
comment: Does not work with Android Wear. I have an LG Sport and the pedometer was 2× too high and the heart rate sensor logged my HR at 230...I should be dead.

author: Mike Sorbo
comment: Really disappointing. Not nearly enough statistics.

author: Tim Petrowitsch
comment: in the timeline perhaps adding the year to the dates would clarify the past while scrolling backwards.

author: Joe Madron
comment: Grossly over counts steps on LG watch sport

author: Mike Scheithauer
comment: It doesn't sync with my watch. Google fit on my wearable works fine but the cellphone app can't interact or download data from my watch!

author: Santiago Arranz Olmos
comment: The app crashes a lot, but the service is quite good.

author: Erick Salinas
comment: App doesn't sync with Android Wear anymore. Hoping the next update fixes it

author: Manuel Perez
comment: Doesn't sync with my LG Sorts watch

author: Sam McCarthy
comment: Needs to take cues from Samsung and Apple heath apps

author: Alexandru Iordache
comment: It doesn't sync anymore  with android wear!!!

author: Saeed 40
comment: The health tracking is great, but sleep tracking would be an amazing edition.

author: Max Goncharov
comment: Still missing competition with friends

author: Donald Agoston
comment: Only one word fantastic app

author: Haley Marie
comment: It works when it wants to work.

author: 2Simba Minecraft
comment: Good app

author: Jordan Long
comment: Despite mirroring settings for workouts between fit app on wear and fit app on phone, the way notifications work is slightly different.  Within the fit app:  On wear 24 during my run, the spoken feedback is total time, total distance, and then AVG pace (in minutes per mile)  On phone, during my run, the spoken feedback is total time, total distance, and then pace from Last mile (in minutes) ^I prefer this and would love to be able to have this configuration on my wear watch. Not sure if the difference is an intentional decision.

author: Mrs. White
comment: I've just completed a 25 minute indoor walking routine. This app says I've only taken 132 steps. My other apps counted 3,335 steps. That was a lot of hard work. And to keep my location on for this app, is really draining my phones battery and it is NOT accurate. I thought I'd give it a try, but it's a waste of time. All other reviews seem to see the same problem.

author: Waleed Khalid Siraj
comment: Very inconsistent and inaccurate when activities are irregular. But that's still acceptable at some level. But the fact the it has wrong information recorded and cannot remove it is not acceptable. User can't remove the misc activity, which in my case is almost always wrong. Motorbike or bus rides are mistaken for cycling.

author: Sunil Sud
comment: Tracking is inaccurate, both route and step count. It may be due to power save mode but google doesn't offer any instructions/documentation, so I'm not sure. Also,  short activities are summarized with no details or map available.

author: Mark Pearson
comment: Why say connect to garmin/my fitness calorie when it doesn't sync any data. You have to manually put in the data to the app, an extra waste of time and energy. Why have an app when you can't sync any data onto it.  Bit of a pointless app myself, save time and energy and DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS APP!!

author: Jessi McNulty
comment: Google fit seems to be very inaccurate. Among other things it tracked me for 20 min bike ride while my phone sat motionless on the charger. It's such a great idea but needs work.
This app used to be great now it won't even track your steps. Wish I could give it negative 100 stars, deleted it off all my devices until they fix it.

author: Ricky Muir
comment: The app varies from day to day in its success. Today , for example, it cut tracking my run for no apparent reason and has, since then, been convinced that I've been doing nothing but running. The speed which these runs are being tracked at vary between 20 min/km and 4min/km. Quite random.
